solution_line_template: At the end of his first week, Brian now has doubled his initial time of {initial_time} seconds to {initial_time}*{double_factor}=<<{initial_time}*{double_factor}={first_week_time}>>{first_week_time} seconds

At the end of his second week, Brian doubled the previous week's time of {first_week_time} seconds to {first_week_time}*{double_factor}=<<{first_week_time}*{double_factor}={second_week_time}>>{second_week_time} seconds

At the end of his third week of practice, Brian adds another 50% of {second_week_time} seconds to his time so {second_week_time}*{percent_increase}= <<{second_week_time}*{percent_increase}={third_week_increase}>>{third_week_increase} seconds added

Having added {third_week_increase} seconds to his time from his second week, Brian can now hold his breath for {second_week_time}+{third_week_increase}= <<{third_week_increase}+{second_week_time}={final_time}>>{final_time} seconds
